info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 8:44PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Pender, Bladen, Robeson, Columbus, central Dillon, north central Horry and east central Marlboro Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 844 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hestertown, or near Lumberton, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Whiteville, Elizabethtown, Rowan, Pembroke, Fairmont, Tabor City, Chadbourn, Bladenboro, Lake Waccamaw, Rowland, Fair Bluff, Lake View, Sandyfield, Boardman, Hallsboro, Hamer, Ammon, Hestertown and Southeastern Community College. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 195 and 198. Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 1 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
